articles.title: Experts: Travel bans, business closures could hurt economy
articles.description: MILWAUKEE (AP) — Travel restrictions and business closures aimed at stopping the spread of a new virus that has killed 259 people in China could end up causing ripple effects that harm the global economy, experts say.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Apple temporarily closes stores in China amid virus outbreak
articles.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple is temporarily closing its 42 stores in mainland China, one of its largest markets, as a new virus spreads rapidly and the death toll there rose to 259 on Saturday.
articles.content:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) Apple is temporarily closing its 42 stores in mainland China, one of its largest markets, as a new virus spreads rapidly and the death toll there rose to 259 on Saturday.

articles.title: Officials confirm 1st case of coronavirus in Massachusetts
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — A Boston man has tested positive for the coronavirus, the first case in the state, Massachusetts officials said Saturday.

articles.title: Coronavirus preparation underway at Maryland's Johns Hopkins

articles.description: A viral outbreak that began in China has infected more than 11,900 people globally.
